Articles.Content:
Javascript is disabled. View full album

Three brave Kerbals embark on a mission to find out what a mysterious energy-emitting object is. What they find is surprising.

As the brave crew in their spacecraft approached the anomalous object, they could make out it's shape. Three cylinders and a disk, connected by pylons of various lengths. "It's some kind of spacecraft" Hudry said. "No, it can't be, we're still a kilometer away" Ersen snapped. "It's clearly a group of asteroids." Rogun agreed. As they approached the anomaly closer and closer, none of them could deny tht it was huge, and that it was a spacecraft. Small areas of exposed machinery were visible, along with windows. Strangely, the anomaly seemed to be dead, no signs of life at all. "Into the lander, let's check this thing out." Hudry told the others. The two clambered aboard the modified lander, whose engine and landing gear were replaced with thrusters and an advanced grabbing unit. They brushed up against the anomaly, then tried to grab on, when they finally attached. Suddenly, the anomaly started shaking, kicking them off. Rogun took this as a demand to leave, so they started flying back to the CSM. Ersen spotted something on the anomoly, an opening, and decided to go inside it instead. Rogun flipped a power switch using the claw, and a picture of the lit-up spacecraft was taken. The two cylinders lit up orange, and the windows came to life. They switched off the power, and went back to the CSM. As they were de-orbiting to Kerbin, they saw the Anomaly vanish, travelling at super speed.

No one knows what the darned thing was... But it was definitely a spacecraft.

The purpose of this was to demonstrate how fun a contract to investigate some anomolous object would be. It gets put in a strange orbit and you rendezvous with it, take some samples, even grab it with a claw. Bring it back if the contract specifies.

Edited January 20, 2015 by GregroxMun
Ha ha! I always love your stuff, Greg!
